title: Hatchy
author: Hatchy
content: I want to bring it to the notice of all newbies and members of this forum there's a new post, going on in different board claiming to give free Bitcoins to all members of this forum. Please don't engage with it, it's a scam. I'm creating this thread because there recent increase in the rate of scammers here on Bitcointalk and they would want to target the newbies especially.This user has created same post on 2 boards, the Eonomy and Bitcoin discussion. He locked both thread so no one would reply. I know that moderators will do away with his post soon, but he is likely to create it somewhere else or even with a new account, so just be careful and don't contact anyone from that website.Quote‚ú¶ ‚ú¶ ‚ú¶ Congratulations! ‚ú¶ ‚ú¶ ‚ú¶‚úî Due to high trading volume on our exchange we want to announce the charity draw in BTC, which was organized by our Trading Platform together with our dear investors from Kraken, we decided to attract new participants and help people in this hard times!‚óè You won: 0.08275 BTCOnly for the first 50 users of BitcoinTalk!‚ìµ Log in/Sing up to https://betradux.com/‚ì∂ Go to the Dashboard ‚ûú Referral ‚ûú Activate refferal code (promocode). ‚ñ∂ Promocode: 2m4sf3‚ì∑ Apply the promo code.‚ì∏ Done, you can use your winnings!‚è≥ You must withdraw the received BTC within 3 days, otherwise, the application will be declined invalid.üî• P2P code can be used once and for one account.üì¨¬†In case of any questions, feel free to contact online support on the main page of the site.¬©The our team wishes you all the best!User profile doproid901

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: Was typing a reply before the thread was locked and later deleted.. will drop the reply below am sure the user will see this thread. QuoteLike you want me to go to this website and claim free Bitcoin worth $2200+ just for free, and this offer is valid for 50 people online, which is about $112,000+ total, that's what you want to give out for free... This lie is too good to be true. Even without going into the site, I can explain how all this will work. If you want someone to create an account on one of your broker sites that has no real users or real-time money on it, then the person will have to use the promo code, which will immediately deposit the audio funds into the user's account. When you try to withdraw the funds, your system will request a withdrawal fee, which the user will have to pay. So that they can be able to withdraw, which, in a normal sense, is meant to be deducted from the withdrawing balance provided they are off the same network. This kind of scam is old-fashioned.  Newbies should all just be careful with anything they see online, and one thing that can make one fall victim to such a scam is if the person is very greedy and eager to make money. If not, it is very obvious that the entire thing is a pure scam that could easily be identified and avoided.

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: Quote from: Bureau on June 05, 2023, 12:13:33 PMAnother scammer coming up with a new strategy. Got instantly exposed and banned. I don't think he came up with anything new. In fact, it's probably one of the oldest tricks in the book. He has created a fake exchange. Once you register an account and apply the coupon code, a fake balance will be displayed in your account. You will think you have bitcoins, and try to withdraw them. That's where the actual scam begins. The site will ask you to deposit a certain amount for "security reasons", "network fees", "verification" or whatever else they have come up with in the meantime. Since greed is sometimes stronger than logic, some people will deposit the asked amount and that's the amount they will get scammed for. On top of that, there is the threat of identity theft if you submit any documents to the site for KYC verification.
